author.name: Nick Crain
author.tagName: I reside in Dallas, TX and cover the Oklahoma City Thunder.
author.description: Nick is a contributor at Forbes covering the Oklahoma City Thunder. He is from Owasso, OK and a 2017 graduate of Oklahoma State University. He’s been around the Thunder since the inaugural 2008 season, growing up as a ball boy for the team. Nick is a credentialed media member and co-host of The Uncontested, a Thunder and NBA podcast.

I love following charts and the biggest and most successful names in the industry, and I'm always interested in highlighting incredible feats and discovering what's next.

author.name: Sharon Edelson
author.shortBio: I write about retail and the forces that are redefining shopping.
author.description: I've been a journalist for 30 years, as a senior editor at W magazine, and for the last 17 years, covering retail and real estate as a senior editor at WWD. I write about luxury boutiques, independent retailers, department stores, mass chains, and digitally native brands, and the force that's redefining the way we shop – Amazon. I break news and interview CEOs of major retailers and REITs, and dig beneath the surface to uncover and analyze the complexities of doing business in the age of COVID-19. After months of quarantine, consumers' buying habits have shifted; they've become more reliant on Amazon than ever. Retailers will have to harness every bit of creativity from their organizations to survive, while addressing key issues such as sustainability and diversity and inclusion.

author.name: Wayne G. McDonnell, Jr., M.B.A.
author.description:
Wayne G. McDonnell, Jr., M.B.A. has been involved in education, media, coaching, and finance for two decades. He achieved the rank of Clinical Professor of Sport Management and served as Academic Chair at New York University’s Tisch Institute for Global Sport. A former financial analyst and accountant at Madison Square Garden, McDonnell is a business of baseball contributor for Forbes Sports Money. He has also written for other sport business periodicals, textbook chapters, and has presented research papers at industry conferences.


McDonnell is currently an Adjunct Full Professor at St. John’s University teaching a course on the Economics of Sport in the Collins College of Professional Studies Division of Sport Management. In his spare time, McDonnell lends his expertise to inCourage, a not-for-profit that helps young athletes and adults redefine success in youth sports. He represents the company as Vice President of Content and Curriculum on panel discussions, conferences, and events.


McDonnell has consistently appeared on television programs on the MLB Network; Bloomberg; Business News Network (Canada); ABC; BBC; NBC; FOX; CNN; Al Jazeera America; SportsNet New York, and the YES Network. He is also frequent guest on radio programs and podcasts analyzing the business of baseball.

author.name: John Byrne
author.shortBio: I run PoetsandQuants.com, which covers news about business schools.
author.description: I’m the editor-in-chief of Poets and Quants, the most read and most popular provider of information on business programs in the world. Our main website, PoetsandQuants.com, has been visited by nearly 100 million people and is updated daily with a wealth of admission and career statistics, school profiles, breaking news and long-form features on programs, students, faculty and alumni. Earlier in my career, I was editor-in-chief of Fast Company and executive editor of Business Week.
author.sigfile: John A. Byrne is editor-in-chief of PoetsandQuants.com, the leading website covering business schools. He is also the former executive editor of Businessweek and former EIC of Fast Company.
